title: Registered Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AbleLight
Interview Descriptions: Keep you waiting on phone, quick questions and then schedule interview. Postponed several times. Not challenging questions. Overall mediocre experience. Neither positive or negative. Want to get through it quickly and seem distracted.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AbleLight
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by multiple staff then leadership. They were interested in me as a person. They were clear about job responsibilities, training, benefits, and pay. I felt I prepared once I started my job.
Interview Questions: What tough situations I had experienced in the past in a similar role.

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AbleLight (Napa, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward and professional. Questions were all relevant to the position. It was a panel interview with the COO, CFO, Regional Director and HR Manager. People were all friendly and as engaged as possible considering the virtual format on Zoom.
Interview Questions: How will you manage multiple complex  projects to ensure timely completion?

title: Internal Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at AbleLight (Brookfield, WI) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very responsive. The whole team was respectful and kind. The process was more conversational than a formal interview. The team appropriately looks to the candidate to talk through history and experience and present any questions. Their mission of helping developmentally and intellectually disabled individuals is contagious.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Bethesda?

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AbleLight (New York, NY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the Indeed Recruiter that they were using to help screen initial candidates. That was about a 30 min conversation she really liked my background sense I worked for a similar agency and she told me she would send my information over to the Regional HR person that covers the Illinois area. Fast forward to a week later , I reached out to her to see if she had heard anything and she followed up right away stating she was waiting to hear back from them as they had been in and out the office. Two days later she let me know that he was putting a schedule so we could interview over the phone the next week. I did the interview about three weeks and have not heard back which he told me I would hear by the next week if moving forward. I just took this as not moving forward since no response was received. It's not a role I was absolutely in love with as the commute was at least and hour and they were on the low end of the salary even for being non-profit. When I spoke with the Indeed Recruiter she told me the cap was about 55k and when I spoke with the Regional HR he said the salary was 48-52k. Still not ideal salary range for a HR Business Partner Role.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary but wanted to know how you collaborate with Managers on employee relations issues such as performance and discipline.

title: Direct Support Professional Interview

Interview Questions: How many job requisitions have I worked on at one time?

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AbleLight (Fort Wayne, IN) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended the job by 2 friends who worked there.  Filled out the online application, and I think a few weeks later, I received a call from a program manager. We did some preliminary questions such as: If I am still interested, and what shifts I am comfortable with, and if I did get hired, there was a mandatory 1 week training before working at the group homes. They usually are once a month, so I had to wait after I finished my Spring semester of college to do it in May.  The manager was lenient and understanding, so he waited until my semester and we did a formal interview.  It was one on one, and he asked different questions and it only took about 30 minutes. And then he talked about the houses and shifts available. He even drove me to the group home I could be potentially be working at to meet the individuals. Afterward, he formally offered the position, and I accepted.
Interview Questions: The individuals are religious and most go to Church on Sundays. Are you comfortable going to church that may be from a different denomination?

title: DSP Interview

title: DSP Interview

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at AbleLight (Portland, OR) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Employee referral, online application process, contacted by recruiter for a phone interview.  Then contacted to set up a one on one interview.  This interview had to be rescheduled a couple of times by Bethesda's management.  Then a panel interview consisting of persons who would be working with me and under my management.  A final interview with the area director who was filling in and covering for the fact that there was no current supervisor for the position I was interviewing for.  Finally there was a background check, fingerprints, drug test and a TB test.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you've had to work with a difficult coworker.
